Class Utility

  • java.lang.Object
    • dml.team5.Utility

  • public final class Utility
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.1 This helper class contains useful utility methods.
    Author:
    Matthew Boyette (N00868808@ospreys.unf.edu)

                                                 throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                        java.sql.SQLException,
                                                        org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                        java.io.IOException
        Creates an XML Document using the DOM API from the resulting CachedRowSet of a SQL query.
        Parameters:
        results - the resulting CachedRowSet of a SQL query.
        Returns:
        the Document.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - if a DocumentBuilder cannot be created which satisfies the configuration requested.
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if a parsing error occurs.
        java.io.IOException - if an input/output error occurs.
        Since:
        1.1

      • executeSQLStatement

        public static final javax.sql.rowset.CachedRowSet executeSQLStatement(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                                      java.lang.String inputString)
                                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes a SQL statement on the database server and returns the corresponding CachedRowSet.
        Parameters:
        connection - the Connection to the database server.
        inputString - the input String containing the SQL query.
        Returns:
        the corresponding CachedRowSet.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, or the given SQL statement produces anything other than a single CachedRowSet object.
        Since:
        1.0

      • writeSQLResults

        public static final java.lang.String writeSQLResults(javax.sql.rowset.CachedRowSet results,
                                                     int minimumFieldWidth)
                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a table String from the results of a SQL query in the form of a CachedRowSet object.
        Parameters:
        results - the CachedRowSet resulting from executing a SQL query.
        minimumFieldWidth - the minimum width of a field in characters.
        Returns:
        the table String.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
        Since:
        1.1

      • writeSQLResults

        public static final java.lang.String writeSQLResults(javax.sql.rowset.CachedRowSet results,
                                                     int minimumFieldWidth,
                                                     char separatorCharacter)
                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a table String from the results of a SQL query in the form of a CachedRowSet object.
        Parameters:
        results - the CachedRowSet resulting from executing a SQL query.
        minimumFieldWidth - the minimum width of a field in characters.
        separatorCharacter - the character used to construct the separator between the table header and the table body.
        Returns:
        the table String.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
        Since:
        1.1
